column4: Hello. I inherited an Ubuntu 9.04 server, which I want to upgrade to 10.04 LTS. When I run sudo do-release-upgradeAn upgrade from 'jaunty' to 'lucid' is not supported with this tool."
I gathered as much from the error message.
Jaunty is EOL... And, you can only upgrade to the next release, meaning Karmic, i.e. 9.10
From THERE, you can upgrade to 10.04
And how do I upgrade to 9.10, so I can then upgrade to 10.04?
It was already on Prompt=normal. And it decided it wanted to go directly from jaunty to lucid, with that error message I started with.
Weird... :/ Well this tool has no freaking manpage so I can't really know the syntax for specifying what to upgrade to
LOL, when I have to resort to IRC for a question, run like hell :)
Another reason why a rolling release distro for a server is a better idea tho
Most of my other boxen are CentOS :P
Um... ew. Sorry but anything RPM-based freaks me out
heh, I must be used to it. I've been using red hat since it was in somebody's garage.
